intro: Micropholis portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and forest understories. Micropholis portoricensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small animals.
